sentences.sentence: The dwarfs( 小矮人 ), when they came home in the evening, found Snow White lying upon the ground.
She breathed( 呼吸 ) no longer, and was dead.
They lifted her up, looked to see whether they could find anything poisonous( 有毒的 ), unlaced( 解开 ) her, combed( 梳理 ) her hair, washed her with water and wine, but it was all of no use.
The poor child was dead, and remained dead.
They laid her upon a bier( 停尸架 ), and all seven of them sat round it and wept( 哭泣 ) for her, and wept for three whole days.
Then they were going to bury( 埋葬 ) her, but she still looked as if she were living, and still had her pretty red cheeks( 脸颊 ).
They said, “We cannot bury her in the dark ground,” and they had a transparent( 透明的 ) coffin( 棺材 ) made out of glass,
so that she could be seen from all sides, and they laid her in it, and wrote her name upon it in golden letters, and that she was a king’s daughter.
Then they put the coffin out upon the mountain, and one of them always stayed by it and watched it.
And birds came too, and wept for Snow White; first an owl( 猫头鹰 ), then a raven( 乌鸦 ), and last a dove( 白鸽 ).
And now Snow White lay a long, long time in the coffin, and she did not change, but looked as if she were asleep;
for she was as white as snow, as red as blood, and her hair was as black as ebony( 乌木 ).
It happened, however, that a king’s son came into the forest, and went to the dwarfs’ house to spend the night.
He saw the coffin on the mountain, and the beautiful Snow White within it, and read what was written upon it in golden letters.
Then he said to the dwarfs, “Let me have the coffin, I will give you whatever you want for it.”
But the dwarfs answered, “We will not part with it for all the gold in the world.”
Then he said, “Let me have it as a gift, for I cannot live without seeing Snow White. I will honor( 尊重 ) and value( 珍视 ) her above all things.”
And as he spoke in this way the good dwarfs took pity upon him, and gave him the coffin.
And now the King’s son had it carried away by his servants on their shoulders.
And it happened that they stumbled( 绊倒 ) over a tree-stump, and with the shock( 剧烈震动 ) the poisonous piece of apple which Snow White had bitten off came out of her throat( 喉咙 ).
And before long she opened her eyes, lifted up the lid( 盖子 ) of the coffin, sat up, and was once more alive.
“Oh, heavens( 天哪 ), where am I?” she cried.
The King’s son, full of joy( 喜悦 ), said, “You are with me,” and told her what had happened, and said,
“I love you more than everything in the world. Come with me to my father’s palace, and you shall be my wife.”
And Snow White was willing, and went with him, and their wedding( 婚礼 ) was held with great show and splendor( 奢华 ).
But Snow White’s wicked( 恶毒的 ) stepmother( 继母 ) was also invited to the feast( 宴会 ).
When she had dressed herself in her most beautiful clothes she stood in front of the Mirror( 镜子 ), and said:
“Mirror, mirror, on the wall,
Who is the fairest of us all?”
The glass answered:
“Although you are of beauty rare( 罕见的 ),
The young bride’s many times more fair!”
Then the wicked woman uttered( 说出 ) a curse( 诅咒 ), and was so utterly( 极度地 ) wretched( 苦恼的 ), that she did not know what to do.
At first she would not go to the wedding at all, but she had no peace, and must go to see the young Queen.
And when she went in she recognized( 认出 ) Snow White; and she stood still with rage( 盛怒 ) and fear, and could not stir( 走动 ).
But iron shoes had already been put upon the fire, and they were brought in with tongs( 火钳 ), and set before her.
Then she was forced to put on the red-hot shoes, and dance until she dropped down dead.

article_info.previous: 恶毒的王后几次三番设计想要杀死“白雪公主”，但是“白雪公主”都被小矮人们救活了。怒不可遏的王后再次利用自己的魔法制成了一个一半有毒一半无毒的苹果，“白雪公主”终被杀掉。
article_info.share_words: They lifted her up, looked to see whether they could find anything poisonous, unlaced her, combed her hair, washed her with water and wine, but it was all of no use.

question.cn: 白雪公主的棺材是由什么制成的？
question.en: What was Snow White’s coffin made out of?

analysis: 文中提到：“And they had a transparent coffin made out of glass, so that she could be seen from all sides, and they laid her in it, and wrote her name upon it in golden letters, and that she was a king’s daughter.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么七个小矮人最终把棺材给王子了？
question.en: Why did the seven dwarfs eventually give the coffin to the prince?

options.cn: 因为王子给了他们一大笔钱。
options.en: Because the prince offered them a lot of money.

options.cn: 因为王子如此真诚，小矮人产生了同情心。
options.en: Because the prince was so sincere that they had pity on him.

options.cn: 因为王子许诺给他们头衔。
options.en: Because the prince promised to give them titles.

analysis: 文中提到：“Then he said, 'Let me have it as a gift, for I cannot live without seeing Snow White. I will honor and value her above all things.' And as he spoke in this way the good dwarfs took pity upon him, and gave him the coffin.”小矮人完全是被王子的真诚所打动，对他产生同情才同意把棺材给他的，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 恶毒的王后是怎么死的？
question.en: How did the wicked Queen die?

options.en: She went mad and killed herself.

options.cn: 她被王子抓住然后被王子杀掉了。
options.en: She was caught and killed by the prince.

options.cn: 她一直跳舞，最后倒地而死。
options.en: She danced until she dropped down dead.

analysis: 文中提到：“Then she was forced to put on the red-hot shoes, and dance until she dropped down dead.”因此答案选C。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第75天
